name: Cyclobarbital
summary: A barbiturate sedative-hypnotic formerly used for insomnia and anxiety, now largely obsolete due to safety concerns and the availability of safer alternatives.
description: Cyclobarbital is a barbiturate derivative with sedative-hypnotic properties, historically prescribed for short-term treatment of insomnia and anxiety. Like other barbiturates, it potentiates GABA-A receptor activity, producing CNS depression. It has largely fallen out of clinical use because of the high risk of dependence, overdose, and respiratory depression, and has been replaced by benzodiazepines and non-benzodiazepine hypnotics.

metadata.dea_schedule: III or IV (varies by country; many countries have withdrawn)

sections.text: Cyclobarbital binds to the GABA-A receptor at the barbiturate site, prolonging the duration of chloride channel opening and enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission in the CNS, leading to sedation and hypnosis.

adult.insomnia: Typically 100–200 mg at bedtime (historical data; not currently recommended)

sections.geriatric: Avoid due to increased sensitivity and fall risk
sections.hepatic_impairment: Avoid or use with extreme caution

other: High risk of fatal overdose, especially with alcohol or other CNS depressants
Potential for severe withdrawal symptoms including seizures
Should not be used in modern clinical practice except in rare, controlled settings

sections.pregnancy: Category D; avoid due to fetal harm risk
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended due to high toxicity risk
sections.geriatrics: Avoid due to high fall and delirium risk

sections.text: Taper slowly over weeks if discontinuing after chronic use to prevent withdrawal seizures.
